intro: Ruilopezia usubillagae, commonly known as the Usubilla grass, is a species of grass native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant is typically found in high-altitude environments, such as mountain slopes and rocky areas. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its environment. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
